chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_pwd l

Premises:
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_pwd_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_pwd_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
rel_prime_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
factorisation : forall n : nat, {l : list (nat * nat) | is_wf l /\ n = refactor l} + {n = 0}
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope

cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
